history.content: You should be fine. The circuits part is not difficult in 16B, and with a strong linear algebra background, you can pick up any missed concepts easily. However, the lab project should be challenging, given that you do not have any hands-on experience in building circuits. But you can always learn and make up for it!
You should be fine.  The circuits are not difficult in 16a, and with a linear algebra background, you can pick up any missed concepts easily.

I'm in a weird spot where I'm a third year math major who just started getting interested in EE.

I've already taken Math 110 and would hate to go through learning linear algebra a third time. I'm also reasonably confident in my ability to self-learn the circuits part.

I've taken all the CS lowerdivs plus 170 (which probably doesn't matter haha).

I'm just wondering if taking EE16B without EE16A and self-studying circuits is a reasonable course of action. I came to the realization that I only have 3 semesters left :'(( and there are so many cool classes I still want to take. So I'd rather not take prereqs that I don't totally need to.
history.subject: Taking EE16B without EE16A? Already have linear algebra background
